trans-unit.source: Creating Derby databases for read-only use

seg-source.mrk: Creating Derby databases for read-only use

target.mrk: Creating Derby databases for read-only use

trans-unit.source: You can create <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases for use on read-only media such as CD-ROMs.

seg-source.mrk: You can create <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases for use on read-only media such as CD-ROMs.

target.mrk: You can create <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases for use on read-only media such as CD-ROMs.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases in zip or jar files are also read-only databases. Typically, read-only databases are deployed with an application in an embedded environment.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases in zip or jar files are also read-only databases.
Typically, read-only databases are deployed with an application in an embedded environment.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> databases in zip or jar files are also read-only databases.
Typically, read-only databases are deployed with an application in an embedded environment.
